sentences.english: I am on the night shift every Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 我每逢星期三都值夜班。

sentences.english: But the night bus should take you there, so it's not too bad.
sentences.chinese: 但是夜班車也能載你去那兒，所以也不會很糟糕。

sentences.english: She promised to see after the children when their mothers were on the nightshift.
sentences.chinese: 她答應在孩子媽媽上夜班時照顧孩子。

sentences.english: It's the night shift here at the operations base and it is finally quiet.
sentences.chinese: 現在是救援中心的夜班時間，世界終於安靜下來。

sentences.english: The passengers disembarked from the night flight.
sentences.chinese: 乘客從夜班飛機上下來。

sentences.english: He is a printer. He works nights.
Working as a journalist at ITN meant regular two-week spells of night shifts.
sentences.chinese: 在ITN當記者意味着有規律的爲期兩週的夜班輪換。

sentences.english: We just arrange night shifts for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 我們就爲每位員工安排夜班。

sentences.english: Do you mind working on the night shift？
She promised to see after the children when their mothers were on the night shift.
sentences.chinese: 她答應在孩子們的媽媽上夜班時照顧這些孩子。

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 抓到小偷的那位夜班警衛因他的警戒而受到表揚。

sentences.english: Nightshift drags on until three in the morning.
An interesting study of the domestic life and health of night-shift workers was carried out by Brown.
sentences.chinese: 一個有趣的家庭生活和健康的夜班工人進行了棕色。

sentences.english: Because he didn't want to take the night train across Finland again.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他不想在撘乘夜班列車回芬蘭了。

sentences.english: He takes a trip in the tight, smelly night mail-coach for Clavering.
sentences.chinese: 他乘一輛擁擠的，氣味熏天的夜班郵車去克拉弗林。

definition: to change shifts/to work in turns
to finish work/to get off work
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to look after a hospitalized loved one
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
to hand over to the next workshift
